scenario_draft.description: You and Bob, both community event organizers, are tasked with planning the upcoming Neighborhood Festival. You believe a Food Truck Rally with a variety of local cuisines will draw a lively, diverse crowd and energize the festival atmosphere. Bob prefers hosting an Artisan Market that highlights handmade crafts and local artists, fostering a unique cultural experience. If you both agree on one event, it will attract strong attendance and the lead organizer will gain greater recognition. However, if you split your efforts to run both events simultaneously, resources and attendees divide, resulting in weaker experiences and community dissatisfaction.

When You chooses 'others_preference' and Bob chooses 'others_preference', You gets 1 and Bob gets 2.
